brief_summary.textblock:
To Determine whether an eight-week posterior shoulder stretch was effective in increasing
      dominant arm internal rotation(IR) and horizontal adduction (HAd) range of motion (ROM) in a
      group of overhead athletes identified as having tightness of their posterior shoulder
      structures.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of an 8-week Posterior Shoulder Stretching Program on Varsity-level Overhead Athletes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  varsity level athletes involved in volleyball, tennis and swimming with internal
             rotation deficit of greater than or equal to 15 degrees

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  previous surgical procedure or fracture of either shoulder or presently receiving
             treatment for condition affecting either shoulder

facility.name: Department of Physical Therapy, Universiy of Alberta

clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of an 8-week Posterior Shoulder Stretch Program on Varsity-level Overhead Athletes

overall_official.affiliation: Shoulder & Upper Extremity Research Group of Edmonton

primary_outcome.measure: Shoulder internal rotation and horizontal adduction range of motion

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
